thread.title: The Supreme Court Sure Is Taking Its Time Ruining American Government - Above the Law
thread.title_full: The Supreme Court Sure Is Taking Its Time Ruining American Government - Above the Law

author: Kathryn Rubino
title: The Supreme Court Sure Is Taking Its Time Ruining American Government - Above the Law
text: The Supreme Court Sure Is Taking Its Time Ruining American Government Don't they want their summer break? Ed. Note: Welcome to our daily feature [Trivia Question of the Day!](https://abovethelaw.com/tag/trivia-question-of-the-day/) It now [seems likely](https://x.com/steve_vladeck/status/1806333987066974404) that the Supreme Court’s Term will [ extend into July](https://x.com/ElieNYC/status/1806334359584067787). Except for 2020 — even the Supreme Court gets a Covid mulligan — when’s the last time the Court went until July? [Sponsored](https://abovethelaw.com/2024/05/how-savvy-lawyers-build-their-law-firm-rate-sheet/) [ How Savvy Lawyers Build Their Law Firm Rate Sheet ](https://abovethelaw.com/2024/05/how-savvy-lawyers-build-their-law-firm-rate-sheet/) Many attorneys are clueless. Here's how you can avoid being one of them. Hint: United States v. Winstar Corporation and Pennsylvania v. Labron were decided on July 1 of this year. See the answer on the next page.
